The closeness to the environmental theme and the young team have created the perfect match for her. Aurora’s favorite naanu cookies are Peanuts and Chocolate Chip!

mixText:
Can’t decide which flavour sounds the most delicious? Or just want to have a choice every day? That’s why we’ve made a mix of our flavours in one pack! You get 10 of each Chocolate Chip, Double Chocolate and Peanut Butter and Chocolate Chip.

Ingredients: Sesame Seeds, Soy Milk, Chia Seeds, Cocoa powder, Peanuts, Sugar, Vanilla, Salt, Chocolate Chips, Vitamin B12, Vitamin D.

noAddedSugarText:
We are constantly improving our recipes to provide you with the healthiest, natural and most delicious versions of naanu. Following the recommendations of the {who} to reduce the consumption of free sugars, we are very happy to introduce our "no added sugar version" of naanu.

These naanu are naturally sweetened with dates, which contain 32-45% less sugar compared to our 'normal' naanu. Additionally, fiber, antioxidants and minerals have a higher content.

Dates also have a lower glycemic index compared to normal sugar, which causes blood sugar to rise at a slower and steadier pace, therefore offering a better alternative for people with type II diabetes.

plantBasedLifeText:
naanu are great for vegans, but benefits people on any type of diet. A vegan diet specifically has many health benefits and does many great things for the planet, but important minerals and vitamins are often lacking in plant-based foods. Deficiencies in vitamins and minerals can cause terrible {healthIssues}.

Most importantly we understand you! That's why our products are natural, free from palm oil, use sustainably sourced ingredients and have a sustainable and reusable packaging.

At naanu everything we do is based on our mindfulness towards the planet.
preOrderYourNaanuText: We are currently only accepting pre-orders as we finalise the rewards of our crowdfunding campaign. We expect to start processing new orders latest by the end of July.

sayingAboutUs: See what our #mynaanu are saying about us!
shareYourReferralLink: Share your personal referral link with your friends and family:
shopText: The base of our naanu is the same throughout all our naanu, we’ve only adapted the amounts of ingredients a little where we needed to make our flavours taste better. Most importantly, they’re all filled with Vitamin B12, Vitamin D, Omega 3, Calcium, Iron and Zinc!
storyOfNaanu1: I became vegan after watching a documentary called {cowspiracy} by {kipAndersen}. Health issues raised in that movie related to the consumption of meat were convincing enough for me to switch diets. On top of that I read {comfortablyUnaware} a book by {oppenlander} and learnt what {klaper}, a physician, had to say about plant-based diets compared to meat based diets ({aboutMilk}) and their effects on the environment and the sustainability of the planet. There are of course a multitude of {reasoning}.
storyOfNaanu2: After doing some more research, I was convinced of the {healthBenefits} and knew it would be better for the {sustainability}.
storyOfNaanu3: What I wasn’t expecting at this point was all the possible deficiencies that a plant-based diet would bring. The easiest solution of course to overcome {possibleDeficiencies} is to take supplements in the form of pills. This is where my annoyance began. I personally hate taking pills and rarely reach for chemically made medication. The very few times I make myself swallow pills is when I’m trying to overcome a migraine.
storyOfNaanu4: At the same time, I have always had a sweet tooth and love chocolatey things. But once I became vegan I think there was probably more than 99% of the sweet things on the shelf at a grocery store that were not vegan. The few sweet vegan things that exist contain palm oil and/ or are wrapped in plastic packaging! These limited options really bothered me and I often made Chocolate Chip Cookies by substituting non-vegan ingredients with plant-based alternatives.
storyOfNaanu5: This is when the idea first came to mind. I believe in “let food be thy medicine” by Hippocrates. So, there must be a way of a) getting all nutrients from natural and vegan sources and b) being able to enjoy taking supplements! Now that I had the idea of something edible that is vegan, how would I get all the nutrients in there and how was I going to figure out if other people also would want something like this? I joined the Founder Institute, a program that helps people with ideas start business and that’s where it all began. You can read about how {naanuStarted} on our Blog.
storyOfNaanu6: I hope you enjoy our naanu!
storyToldByJulia: Here’s the story of naanu, told by our Founder, {julia}.

thanksForYourOrderText: Keep an eye out for an email from us to confirm the shipment of your order, or any follow-ups we need. In case you have any questions you can email us at {email} or follow us on {instagram} to keep up with our news!
theProcessAtNaanuText:
We’re a startup, so our process is our most important secret! We can’t give you the exact details, otherwise some big company might come along and copy what we’re doing. But because you’re important to us, we wanted to explain some parts of our process.
Our ingredients go through a very lengthy process to make sure each naanu has high levels of vitamins and minerals. If you were to mix all ingredients together and eat it like that you’d be lacking some very important nutrients!!
There are many parts to our all-natural process. As we’re still an early-stage startup we’re still testing the best way to make our naanu while making sure that we don’t compromise on flavour.
Have a look at what some of our customers are saying on {instagram}!
